column5: AAL So based on MS report not only is AAL operating inefficiently vs the other major carriers now they are going to have a much higher labor structure than them as well Is AAL really becoming the worst of the worst in every operating category Only hope is to sell off the company in pieces to more efficient operators

AAL The low PEG Ratio which compensates the PE for growth indicates a rather cheap valuation of the company chartmillcomanalyzephpu

AAL after merging with US Air in 2013 it was 25 per share with 730M shares outstanding for a market value of 1825B They bought back almost 290M shares and now have 444M Based on Fridays close of 3175 it was worth 141B So 5 years after the merger it has lost 4B in value despite almost 290M less shares Assuming AAL buys back no shares at 26 and 444M shares AAL would be valued at 115B According to Morgan Stanly this will lose 26B in value in the next year Does that smell like BS to anyone else
AAL the manipulation is real you guys Morgan stanley upgradING UAL with 110 price target and cutting AAL to 26 The valuation and PE difference would be astonishing
